poem:
### Little Tokyo Cheers

In the dim hum of Far Bar  
glasses clink to Ohtani's flight—  
a high arc, a warm sake tide.  
Tahara spills joy like moonlight,  
each homer a bell, each shot  
a whisper:  
"Here, in this shared moment,  
we rise."
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Ohtani-mania: Los Angeles’s Little Tokyo is booming with baseball fans During the past couple of months, Don Tahara has given out nearly 100 bottles of free sake to celebrate Shohei Ohtani’s late-season heroics for the Los Angeles Dodgers. At Little Tokyo’s Far Bar, a gastropub Tahara opened 18 years ago, every patron receives a shot on the house each time Ohtani hits a homer. The “Shohei sake shot” special hasn’t been a cheap expenditure, but". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
